page.title: 17EVENTS
page.content: The{Links Market}has been coming to Kirkcaldy every year for over{six {hundred years.}It began as a weekly market in 1304 and in 1305 a fair was permitted.Gradually the market disappeared but the fair continued for the amusement of the people. It is held in{April}and is here for four or five days. The stalls and amusements are set up along the {mile {long Esplanade. What the people like about the Market are the crowds,the music,the smell of hot-dogs and chips,the fast rides,the colourful stalls and most of all the exciting atmosphere. This year the Market was opened by councillor King the chairman of Kirkcaldy District Council.
